page.title: 07Village School - Hordon
page.content: The present School is brick built and situated in Hillcrest Road on land which was formerly a recreation ground. The notice closing the footpath across this area from Mill Lane to the High Road has only recently been published. The old School is used by the Youth Centre. One of the two demountable classrooms was dismantled and removed in May. There are 147 pupils aged from 5 to 11 in 5 classes. The Head is Mrs. S. Gascoigne and there are 5 teachers Mr. R. Matthews (Deputy Head) Mrs. Porter, Miss Collings, Mrs. Jones and Mrs. Springett. The children go by coach on Thursday to swim at Corringham Pool. After the School Harvet Service in Church the children take gifts to the old people in the village.
